item.title: How do we verify linear separability with Python?
item.description: Two sets $ A $ and $ B $ in an $ n $ dimensional Euclidean space are linear separable if there exist $ n + 1 $ numbers $ w_i \in \mathbb{R} $ such that every point $ a \in A $ satisfies $$ \sum_{i=1}^{n}w_i a_i > k, $$ and every point $ b \in B $ satisfies $$ \sum_{i=1}^{n}w_i b_i < k, $$ where $ k \in \mathbb{R} $ defines a linear border (e.
